|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |                                                                                                     |
| A lillend:* can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly").
* has a [serpent body](/wiki/Slithy "Slithy").
* is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to eat.
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is female.
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* does not appear in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").
* normally appears in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless"). |                                                                                                     |

A **lillend**, A, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") are generated with six [masks](/wiki/Mask_\(dNetHack\) "Mask (dNetHack)") in their inventory, and may substitute the attacks of the creature shown on a mask for their natural attack routine. Additionally, their songs buff nearby monsters.

- Song of courage: Buffs nearby (range 4) allied monsters, adding between one and singer's level3 to each monster's attack and damage.
- Song of good health: Cures nearby (range 4) allied monsters of most status ailments (cancellation, laughter, blindness, berserk, paralysis, studied, stun, confusion, sleeping, frightened), resets their special attack cooldown, and heals them by up to their level in HP.
- Song of haste: Speeds up nearby (range 4) allied monsters, adding 12 movement points and granting them permanent intrinsic haste.

As a pet, a lillend's songs will buff other tame monsters, but will not buff the player. Lillendi will sing along with the player character, improving their songs. Lillendi also share the Troubadour's *write me a saga* special: each time they observe an allied monster gain experience, they also gain experience.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Lillend](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lillend "wikipedia:Lillend")***

## Encyclopedia entry

A lillend has the torso, arms, and head of a comely man or woman,  
but also has broad, powerful, feathered wings and a stout  
serpentine body from the waist downwards. Though the humanlike  
portions of a lillend are of unremarkable hue, the feathered and  
scaled parts of its anatomy are brightly colored and strikingly  
patterned. Each individual has its own unique color combination  
and is quite proud of it. A lillend wears no clothing but  
sometimes wears jewelry. It always carries weapons and musical  
instruments.  
  
Lillendi social status depends on a simple system of initiations  
into mysteries and the ownership of certain totem masks. The  
mysteries are akin to secret societies, and each mystery is a  
specific kernel of wisdom passed on from one generation to the  
next. The more societies a lillend is a member of, the greater  
her status. Each society is devoted to particular musical forms,  
songs, instruments, and weapons, so a group of lillendi usually  
uses the same instruments, weaponry, and spells.  
  
The masks are tangentially related to the societies, since each  
mask design belongs to a specific family, and long ago each  
family lived in a single lodge and wore a single type of mask.  
Things have gotten a little more complicated since then, but the  
masks still roughly indicate status and family affiliations.

\[ Dungeons and Dragons 2nd Edition  
Complete Monstrous Manual ]

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Lillend

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
A lillend (No tile)
Difficulty 17
Attacks Weapon 1d6 physical, Offhand Weapon 1d6 physical, Bearhug 2d4 drowning
A lillend (No tile)
Difficulty 17
Attacks

Weapon 1d6 physical, Offhand Weapon 1d6 physical, Bearhug 2d4 drowning

Base level 14
Base experience 496
Speed 10
Base AC 5
Base MR 33
Alignment -12 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable No
Weight 3000
Nutritional value 400
Size medium
Resistances poison

A lillend:

  • can fly.
  • has a serpent body.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is female.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
  • normally appears in small groups.
  • never leaves a corpse.

A lillend, A, is a type of monster are generated with six masks in their inventory, and may substitute the attacks of the creature shown on a mask for their natural attack routine. Additionally, their songs buff nearby monsters.

  • Song of courage: Buffs nearby (range 4) allied monsters, adding between one and singer's level3 to each monster's attack and damage.
  • Song of good health: Cures nearby (range 4) allied monsters of most status ailments (cancellation, laughter, blindness, berserk, paralysis, studied, stun, confusion, sleeping, frightened), resets their special attack cooldown, and heals them by up to their level in HP.
  • Song of haste: Speeds up nearby (range 4) allied monsters, adding 12 movement points and granting them permanent intrinsic haste.

As a pet, a lillend's songs will buff other tame monsters, but will not buff the player. Lillendi will sing along with the player character, improving their songs. Lillendi also share the Troubadour's write me a saga special: each time they observe an allied monster gain experience, they also gain experience.

Origin

Encyclopedia entry

A lillend has the torso, arms, and head of a comely man or woman,
but also has broad, powerful, feathered wings and a stout
serpentine body from the waist downwards. Though the humanlike
portions of a lillend are of unremarkable hue, the feathered and
scaled parts of its anatomy are brightly colored and strikingly
patterned. Each individual has its own unique color combination
and is quite proud of it. A lillend wears no clothing but
sometimes wears jewelry. It always carries weapons and musical
instruments.

Lillendi social status depends on a simple system of initiations
into mysteries and the ownership of certain totem masks. The
mysteries are akin to secret societies, and each mystery is a
specific kernel of wisdom passed on from one generation to the
next. The more societies a lillend is a member of, the greater
her status. Each society is devoted to particular musical forms,
songs, instruments, and weapons, so a group of lillendi usually
uses the same instruments, weaponry, and spells.

The masks are tangentially related to the societies, since each
mask design belongs to a specific family, and long ago each
family lived in a single lodge and wore a single type of mask.
Things have gotten a little more complicated since then, but the
masks still roughly indicate status and family affiliations.

[ Dungeons and Dragons 2nd Edition
Complete Monstrous Manual ]

A '''lillend''', {{brightgreen|A}}, is a type of [[monster]] are generated with six [[mask (dNetHack)|mask]]s in their inventory, and may substitute the attacks of the creature shown on a mask for their natural attack routine. Additionally, their songs buff nearby monsters.

* Song of courage: Buffs nearby (range 4) allied monsters, adding between one and {{sfrac|singer's level|3}} to each monster's attack and damage.
* Song of good health: Cures nearby (range 4) allied monsters of most status ailments (cancellation, laughter, blindness, berserk, paralysis, studied, stun, confusion, sleeping, frightened), resets their special attack cooldown, and heals them by up to their level in HP.
* Song of haste: Speeds up nearby (range 4) allied monsters, adding 12 movement points and granting them permanent intrinsic haste.

As a pet, a lillend's songs will buff other tame monsters, but will not buff the player. Lillendi will sing along with the player character, improving their songs. Lillendi also share the Troubadour's ''write me a saga'' special: each time they observe an allied monster gain experience, they also gain experience.
